DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : - To determine feasibility implement educational skill train intervention parent childhood cancer survivor neurobehavioral dysfunction use face-to-face training session phone assistance . - To pilot test collect preliminarily data indirect therapeutic impact parent train intervention child 's academic , cognitive , behavioral functioning . - To pilot test collect preliminary outcome parent train intervention parent childhood cancer survivor neurobehavioral dysfunction . OUTLINE : Parent child participant randomize 1 2 intervention arm . - Arm I ( parent intervention program usual care ) : In addition medical care , child participant family may access multidisciplinary psychosocial service ( i.e. , usual care ) . Parents also receive 8 weekly face-to-face training session ( 75-90 minute ) therapist approximately 2-3 month . The training session include integration didactic review parent 's role behavioral emotional support system child 's school success ; parent 's role monitor motivator school performance ; parent 's role intervener teacher effective learn study strategy ; parent 's role child advocate accessor educational community resource . Parents instructed engage ≥ 30 minute cognitive academic activity child ≥ 4 day week . The therapist observe parent ( home clinic ) apply knowledge technique learn parent training session directly child least 4th parent-therapist session provide feedback parent child ass parent may require intense train support . The session may videotape parent provide therapist review follow . Phone support/assistance provide therapist within 2-3 day follow training session provide additional problem-solving assistance teach support parent implement knowledge strategy learn training session measure study adherence behavioral implementation session . After completion training session , continue phone support/assistance provide therapist every 2 week 6 month provide ongoing support problem-solving teach assistance need promote ongoing maintenance train parent practice great degree independence . `` Booster '' in-person session may also occur determine need therapist parent . - Arm II ( wait-list/usual care control [ UCC ] ) : Child participant family undergo usual care arm I place wait-list . Parent child participant arm complete battery test questionnaire baseline , 3 month , 6 month . Battery test include Wechsler Individual Achievement Test ( WIAT-II ) WISC-IV Working Memory Index Children 's Memory Scale ( CMS ) subtests . Questionnaires include parent , teacher , child [ self-report ] questionnaire ( BASC-II , BRIEF , SMALSI ) ; Parent Behaviors Questionnaire-Revised ; Parent Knowledge Efficacy Questionnaire ; Parent 's Treatment Barriers Satisfaction Questionnaire .
